intro: Melicope bonwickii, commonly known as the Kauai melicope, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of mesic forests. Melicope bonwickii is considered a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution across the island of Kauai.
